CatDescriptText: Mr. James Howe, Tustin Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 25, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think Negroes should hold high political offices, particularly those which have payrolls attached?" answer reads: "I think so, because they have the right to hold such offices."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Howe wearing fedora, dark corduroy jacket, and light colored overcoat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
